s281: Twenty-third. Attacked Nanyang magistrate Yi, defeated him east of Yangcheng walls.
s288: Eleventh. Xiang Yu made an appointment with Zhang Han at Yin Xu, Zhang Han and others had already surrendered, made alliance with them, made Han Yong king.
s291: Twenty-fourth. Surrendered and pacified Nanyang, enfeoffed its magistrate Yi.
s294: Fifteenth. Shen Yang pacified Henan, surrendered to Chu.
s296: Eighth month. Zhao Gao killed the Second Emperor.
s298: Twelfth. Made surrendered Qin duwei Yi and chief clerk Xin supreme generals, commanding surrendered Qin troops.
s299: Twenty-first. Zhao King Xie remained in his state. Chen Yu fled and dwelt in Nanpi.
s311: Twenty-sixth. Attacked and took Ao and Lantian. Using Liu Hou's strategy, without battle all surrendered.
s318: Fourteenth. Xiang Yu led the lords' troops, over four hundred thousand, marched raiding territory, west to Henan.
s319: Twenty-third. Zhang Er followed Chu west into Qin.
s321: Twenty-seventh. Han first year, Qin prince Ziying surrendered. Pei Gong entered and broke Xianyang, pacified Qin, returned army to Bashang, awaited the lords' agreement.
s323: Fifteenth. Followed Xiang Yu raiding territory, then entered the pass.
s328: Fifteenth. Yu falsely pit-killed two hundred thousand surrendered Qin soldiers at Xin'an.
s331: Twenty-eighth. Pei Gong issued the three chapter command, Qin people greatly pleased.
